Prasmanan masakan tradisional banyak varian menunya, harga nasi+sayur ambil sepuasnya 13.000, tambah lauk bayar lagi. Setelah ambil bawa ke kasir dan sebut meja nomer berapa. Bayar setelah selesai makan, harga relatif murah makan minum untuk 10 orang habis 360 rb.

Selain prasmanan juga ada ala carte bakmie dll. Minumannya mulai es dawet sampai kopi2 an ada. Ada side dish dimsum dan bubur jawa. Lokasi di pinggir sawah suasananya syahdu. Tempat duduk banyak, ada rooftop, ada toilet dan musholla yg proper.

Parkirannya kurang luas, sudah ada lahan parkir sendiri tapi masih penuh juga karna kesana pas jam makan siang dan musim libur sekolah rame banget, akhirnya parkir di lapangan di deket situ.
makanannya enak2, tempatnya oke bgt, n servicenya juarakkk, sehat2 mba2 n mas2 waiters??
Suasana pedesaan membuat suasana ngobrol menjadi nyaman
Makanan lumayan, cocok dengan lidah. Banyak jenis makanan yang tidak ada di resto atau warung lain. Recomended buat orang yang suka coba suasana baru
Makanan Rumahan Ala ala Desa, Makanannya Enak

- Makanan -
Semua makanannya menurutku termasuk dalam spektrum enak. Kalo kita makan di sini pasti dibandingin sama Kopi Klothok, jadi harus aku sampaikan kalo dibandingkan Kopi Klothok, makanan di sini masih kalah dikit. Mungkin menang di variasi makanan dan minumannya yang banyak banget, mulai dari yg menu kampung sampai menu modern.

- Pelayanan -
Beberapa kali ke sini belum pernah sekalipun ketemu staf yg jutek. Semuanya ramah, peduli, dan mau ngejelasin dengan baik kalo kita tanya tentang menu makanan.

- Atmosfer -
Sekali lagi kalo dibandingin sama Kopi Klothok, aku relatif lebih suka di sini karena tempat duduknya banyak, nyaman2 semua, ada yg "dekat dengan alam", ada juga yang modern kayak di coffeshop gitu. Musholla nya juga luas dan bersih. Salah satu alasan aku sering balik lagi ke sini adalah atmosfernya ini mantap.

Overall, jelas aku akan balik ke sini lagi. Ya sebenernya selama ini juga lumayan rutin ke sini, sekitar 1-2x tiap bulan karena memang nyaman banget tempatnya.
Alhamdulillah pertama kali ke resto ini gak ngecewain, udh makanan enak,pelayanan ramah2 dan suasananya Instagram mebel banget. Kalau ke Jogja harus mampir lagi sih ke resto ini

Uda 3x kesini dan 3x juga pesanan yang dipesen dr menu (bukan prasmanan) lama sekali keluarnya. Yang terakhir ini parah sekali, uda pesen lagi untuk dibungkus, pas mau bayar ternyata ga dibuatkan. Alasannya tidak tau nomer mejanya berapa. Lawak banget, gatau ya balik lagi dilihat meja berapa, sambil crosscheck pesanan untuk takeaway sudah benar atau belum. Uda gt ga minta maaf, malah nyolot bilang dibuatkan dulu berkenan tunggu ga. Tolong deh servicenya ditingkatkan lagi, kl emg understaffed ya hiring lagi, komunikasi server sm kasir dan kitchen diperbaiki. Tempat uda bagus, makanan enak, tp kl service jelek ya ttp aja nol besar, pdhal cukup pricy. Please educate ur staff on how to handle customer with respect. Thx.

Tapi kalo mau makan, nggak ada yang manteb. Sayur jantung, misalnya, mustinya enak, tapi kemanisan dan terlalu pedas. Nggak ramah anak. Mustinya nggak sepedas itu, biar anak-anak bisa makan. Kalo kurang pedas, buat beberapa orang, sediakanlah sambal.

Brongkosnya, udah betul kental kuahnya, tapi kebanyakan kencur, rasanya malah jadi kayak jamu.

Perlu ditingkatkan lagi kualitas makanannya.

10 bulan lalu tmpt ini msh nyaman untuk dikunjungi.  Sejak July, menurut saya sebagai warga lokal, sudah banyak penurunan dalam hal service, harga dan taste makanan.  Memang infrastruktur untuk parkir dan bangunan tmpt makan banyak di perbaharui, tetapi fasilitas fisik tidaklah cukup untuk warga lokal untuk setia datang.  Saya pernah datang jam 7.10 pagi, karena ada tamu keluarga dari luar kota, tapi makanan dan tempat sama sekali belum ready.  Mau order snack belum bisa.  Makanan di buffet juga baru ada separo.  Tempat masih sangat kotor.  Mas yng di kasir juga acuh tak acuh.  Mengapa kalau memang tidak ready di paksakan untuk buka di pukul 7 pagi.  Lebih baik jam buka nya di rubah.  Tetapi mungkin spt resto lain.  Jika sudah ada NAMA dan TERKENAL, kemudian kepuasan customer rakyat kecil spt saya diabaikan.  Lain hal jika mungkin saya seorang artis, public figure ataupun pejabat.  Please deh.  Ngono yo ngono ning ojo ngono.  Lagipula FAME tidak abadi.  Btw, sy juga sudah DM di IG Pawon Mbah Gito sebelum saya menulis disini (perihal yng sama), tetapi jawabannya hanya terima kasih semoga berkah selalu.  Jawaban ne AMBYAR menurutku.

Menu masakan jawa enak dan hampir sama dengan resto2 lain ala prasmanan di Jogja. Tempat parkir relatif terbatas namun disediakan lahan parkir yg lumayan luas +- 100 meter. Tempat dan suasana nyaman dan terus bertambah sampe belakang. No kontak kurang respon jika ingin reserve. Saran saja utk akhir pekan disediakan live music agar makin cozy suasananya.

sebenarnya makanan enak, suasana jg enak tp utk pelayanan kurang, mis: minum keluar terlalu lama, sendok hbs kita hrs minta, sambl juga g ada hrs minta dan nunggu 5 menit. katanya msh beku baru di panasin.

Restoran bernuansa Jawa, menu dan tempatnya. Aneka menu prasmanan khas masakan rumahan dan menu Ala Carte. Tersedia juga aneka minuman, kopi, jus buah dan minuman rempah. Suasana adem dan syahdu seperti di desa, kanan kiri masih sawah produktif, didukung bangunan tradisional Jawa menambah lekat dengan rumah simbah tempo dulu. Lokasinya di pinggir jalan, tersedia parkiran cukup luas. Pelayanan cepat dan ramah.  Rekomended untuk makan bersama keluarga, makan sendiripun tetap terasa nikmatnya.
Suasana dan makanan enak sih,tp yg bikin males tukang parkirnya,cuma duduk aja ga bantuin keluar masuk mobil

Overall good experience untuk sarapan di tempat ini. Cuma ada saran yg baiknya ditindaklanjuti oleh manajemen terkait cara komunikasi karyawan ke customer dan antar karyawan. Terutama dari mas2 yg bagian pencatatan makanan krn paling depan sbg representatif. Pemilihan kalimat dan nada bicara mas nya kurang pas untuk orang yg bekerja melayani customer secara langsung, pun dg komunikasi dari mas nya ke mbak kasir sebelahnya yg kesannya nyalahke. Mbak nya yaa nginput dr yg udah dicatat mas nya dan udah betul inputannya tp masih kena tegur di depan customer. Hal2 yg seharusnya tidak perlu didengar oleh customer.

Impresi pertama: lantainya disapu lagi setelah pengunjung selesai makan.
Crewnya sopan, masakannya enak.
Sepoi-sepoi cocok buat bersantai.

Saya cukup sering makan disini ketika bertolak ke Jogja, ini merupakan lokasi pilihan pertama saya ketika saya sampai di jogja. Hari ini saya cukup kecewa dengan pelayanan dari salah satu waiters yang menyambut kami. Kami datang 4 orang dan Kami diminta untuk memilih kursi, kami pilih meja kursi yang cukup besar untuk 6 orang yang masih tersisa 2 dan belum di reservasi, akan tetapi tidak di berikan dengan alasan kami hanya 4 orang, sedangkan saya tahu bahwa meja untuk 4 orang ini cukup kecil dengan rencana pesanan kami yg cukup banyak. Mau tidak mau kami tetap mengambil meja tersebut dan mengurangi jumlah pesanan agar tidak terlalu penuh, di selang itu waiters lain memberikan meja tersebut kepada pelanggan lain dengan jumlah pengunjung 4 orang dan 1 meja lagi hanya 2 orang dengan kondisi masih ada meja untuk 4 orang lainnya yg masih available. Bagaimana bisa SOPnya seperti itu? Mohon untuk tidak pilah pilih dalam pemilihan/pemberian meja tamu, apabila memang ada SOP harap bisa diseragamkan untuk semua waiters. Semoga bisa lebih baik dalam memberikan pelayanan ke tamu-tamu lainnya.

Ambil makan sendiri model prasmanan. Harga satu jenis nasi dan sayur  per person 13k, belum termasuk minum dan lauknya. Harga lauk bervariasi sekitar 8-20K. Biasanya kalap sih, jadi bisa ambil 3 lauk. Rasanya enak memenuhi rasa nostalgis masakan Jawa. Pemandangan sawah di sekitar jadi poin plus

Sudah berkali-kali mampir Pawon Mbah Gito, baik sarapan ataupun makan malam. Selalu jadi pilihan kalau bingung mau makan di mana.

Rasa makanan selalu konsisten, enak & fresh. Variasi minuman juga OK, dari kopi tradisional, espresso based, sampai macam-macam wedangan. Suasana selalu menyenangkan. Pelayanan selalu OK. Toilet bersih. Musholla luas dan bersih.

Saat peak season, didepan ada papan fully booked, tapi saat masuk ada bbrp meja kosong yg bisa lsg dudukin tanpa reserve, jadi saran saya mending lsg masuk resto cari meja yang kosong, karena ga ada koordinasi antara karyawan yg di dalam resto sama karyawan yang didepan (pintu masuk).
Masya Allah recommend banget disini. makanan nya enak, pelayanannya bagus, dan tempatnya enak suasana pedesaan. yang belum ke Pawon Mbah gito bener² harus mampir sih, soalnya nyaman banget...

Hidden gems .. lauk prasmanan ala jawa, makanannya enak , antri tapi ga lama cepet coz tempatnya luas .. sbnere mskn jawa gini sering sy makan dan kurang bgitu suka tapi ini enaak sekali .. bumbunya miroso, variatif menu banyak dan dawet nya the best manis gula jawa dan warnanya lucu, mba2 nya pelayanan ramah sekali dari depan sampe blkg disambut pulang juga demikian .. Tukang parkir harus di edukasi bahwa ini adalah restoran untuk publik, bukan properti pribadi. Saya baru datang drop off turun mobil langsung diomel2in tukang parkir dan "diusir" padahal posisi mobil di dalam parkiran, tidak mengganggu, dan ada driver saya jg di dalam mobil. Alasan dia : saya bukan mba d*vina yg sudah lebih dulu reservasi. Cuma mau turun dari mobil loh!! Nyebelin banget untuk impresi pertama saya kesini ????

Saat saya masuk, kondisi di dalam banyak yg udah mau selesai, lg siap2 mau keluar, dsb. Gak lucu aja sih orang baru dateng udah langsung diusir sama tukang parkir, dibilang penuh dan ga reservasi, bukan nya cari solusi harus drop off / parkir dimana atau koordinasi kek ada orang resto nya di depan. Sebaiknya SOP drop off dan parkir diperbaiki lagi deh ya.

Saat saya makan, saya liat pelayan sdg antar donat utk table lain tapi dicegat oleh ibu-ibu yg mau pinjem donat tsb utk difoto2 sbg konten di table depan sawah, padahal donat itu bukan pesenan ibu2 tsb. Harusnya pelayan bisa lebih tegas, makanan orang kok diizinin buat dipinjem ngonten begitu..

Sejujurnya, makanan yg saya pesan enak semua, mangut lele dan telor dadar nya enak, sayur nya enak, wedang dan gorengan nya jg enak. Sayang aja kalau makanan udah enak tapi tim pendukung (terutama tukang parkir) kurang bagus, mungkin akan bikin orang jd males untuk balik lg..
Seperti tempat2 ngopi yg lain..yg membedakan adalah disini ada menu rawon yg enak persis rawon Jawa timuran...
Tempatnya adem. Cocok untuk bawa mertua kesini. Dijamin makin disayang mertua! Hehe.

waktu mau pilih meja buat makan siang, rumah makan yg dekat kolam angsa dan ikan banyak lalat dan lebah, minta tolong untuk pengelola sebaiknya jangan taruh angsa di lokasi tempat makan karena bau kotoran dan mengundang lalat

Jujur yaa agak kaget dengan harga yang menurut saya over price, sedikit share ajaa cuma berdua makan makanan yang sama yaitu nasi sayur sop, telur dadar & tempe sama sundukan paru dan esteh 2 dengan total bill 85 ribu agakkk kaget dan jangan dinamakan pawon sih lebih baik resto karena menurut saya bukan standarnya harga sayur sop di jogja huhu, mungkin ada yang beranggapan target pasar bukan saya atau siapapun tapi menurut saya terlalu over price dengan rasa yang cenderung biasa saja
Paket komplit. Konsep prasmanan, makanan yang enak, layanan yang ramah, dan suasana yang menyenangkan.

Tempatnya bagus ya, bisa buat healing karna dikelilingi sawah. Bangunan nya juga cocok banget dipadupadankan sama sawah sawah sekitarnya. Rasa makanan relatif, balik lagi ke selera masing-masing orang. Kalau saya sekeluarga ya standar saja rasanya. Kami pesan beberapa menu yang tidak prasmanan dan menunggunya agak lama, yang akhirnya dibungkus saja. Ada musholanya juga yang bersih dan baby chair untuk balita.

Makanan enak2 smua. Pelayanan cepat. Suasana tidak nyaman. Terlalu banyak orang, dg space jalan yg sempit..gak enak bgt udh nyendok nasi penuh kesenggol sm pengunjung yg lg lewat dibelakang tmpt duduk. Dan nasinya tumpah
enak bgtt buat sarapan karena masakan rumahann??
Makanannya enak, kopinya mantap, pelayanannya ramah,  dan suka dengan fasilitas ibadahnya. Jadi bukber disana bisa sholat dengan baik ?? Sukses selalu ??

Salah satu tempat di jogja yang menawarkan atmosfer pedesaan dan makanan rumahan yang disajikan secara prasmanan. Secara situasi dan lokasi ukup asik untuk nge-chill di akhir pekan.

NAMUN, saat weekend, lebih baik ke sini saat jam buka (sekitar pukul 7), jika ingin sesi bersantai tidak terganggu dengan banyak orang yang beristirahat setelah bersepeda atau rombongan keluarga yang sarapan di jam-jam di atas jam 7.30-an. Selain itu, semakin siang, parkiran dekat lokasi cukup susah didapat, meskipun mereka juga menawarkan valet.

Jangan kaget kalau begitu jalan masuk, kamu disambut area yang isinya kursi meja dan pojok suvenir karena lokasi untuk makan ada di belakang. Ketika masuk, ambil makanan yang diinginkan, ke kasir untuk hitung makanan serta pesan minuman. Setelah itu, akan diberikan nomor meja untuk pengantaran minuman.

Pastikan sebelum pulang bayar yakkk.. soalnya, proses pembayaran dilakukan di kasir sebelum kamu pulang. Apalagi kalau kamu memilih duduk di area depan resto. Lalu, sekalian menghindari bingung antri bayar karena kasir checking makanan dan bayar jadi satu. hehehe.

Nah, dari segi makanan, makanan yang ditawarkan cukup bervariasi mulai dari pilihan nasi merah dan putih, sayur lodeh, hingga lauk pendamping seperti telur, tahu tempe bacem, dan sate ayam, serta masih banyak lagi.

Minuman yang ada di menu juga beragam mulai dari wedang-wedangan seperti teh, minuman sereh, lalu ada juga jus, hingga kopi tubruk hingga americano.

Secara harga relatif harga restoran berada di range medium tergantung jenis lauk yang diambil serta minuman yang dipesan.

Secara keseluruhan, aku suka sih makan di sini. Hal yang terpenting, proses jalan dan naik turun di lokasi tidak ekstrem, jadi untuk yang bawa orang tua atau kursi roda, jalan tidak terlalu bumpy dan berbahaya.
makanan khas rumahan, enak, banyak pilihan menu, tempat luas, dekat dengan uii, akses mudah, tempat luas, mushola bersih dan nyaman
Lokasinya nyaman... .. Menu ala jawanya memuaskan

Variasi menu prasmanan sangat banyak dan lengkap, rasa mantap, pelayanan ok, tempat parkir sudah ditambah di area samping, area makan juga sudah diperluas sampai bagian belakang

makanan rasa nya cukup, cuma note d depan perlu di perhatikan, dan letak makanan untuk ambil cukup susah kalo ada rombongan masuk. pelayanan kemarin kurang memuaskan karena staff ketika pesan respon lama, ada yang kurang2, dan tidak di jelaskan untuk harga pengambilan lauk

Resto ini bukan berada di pinggir jalan raya, tapi harus masuk ke jalan desa. Area parkirnya terbatas apabila penuh harus parkir di area yang jaraknya sekitar 100meter dari resto. Gunakan gmaps akan sangat membantu. Menu makanan nya prasmanan dengan beberapa varian. Mayoritas rasa makanan oke, dengan harga middle up. Cuma sayang ketika mau masuk ke toilet ada tulisan wajib melepas alas kaki, bagi saya ini sangat tidak nyaman!!! Pihak resto harus memahami apabila ada penyakit yang bisa ditularkan melalui air seni dan tinja sehingga akan riskan apabila kita harus melepas alas kaki apalagi di toilet umum bukan pribadi. Apabila pihak resto merasa keberatan atau takut toilet nya kotor akibat dipakai tamu resto, maka lebih baik ditutup saja toiletnya. Ingat kita mau masuk ke toilet bukan masuk ke tempat ibadah sehingga wajib lepas alas kaki!!!

Tersedia menu prasmanan dan ala carte.  Menu makanan khas citarasa Jawa-Jogja. Menyediakan minuman tradisional yang menghangatkan tubuh.

Terdapat mushola yang bersih dan cukup luas. Fasilitas toilet duduk cukup bersih. Banyak spot untuk dijadikan latar belakang berfoto.

Kesini bersama keluarga besar, banyak menu yg sudah kosong & menunya luamaaaaaaa banget gak keluar2, keluar pun satu2 ( jarak keluar antar menu lama ).
Setiap pelayan antar menu, Kita selalu update menu apa aja yg keluar, tau2 ntar dibilang habis menu yg dipesan ( antara bagian dapur, kasir & pelayan gak sikron, yg satu bilang habis, yg satu bilang masih ).
Setelah sebagian menu keluar, menu yg lain gak keluar2 lagi tapi menu pengunjung yg lain, yg datengnya jauhhhhh duluan Kita sudah keluar ( padahal menu pengunjung yg lain itu sama dgn menu Kita yg belum keluar ).
Setelah Kita tunggu sekian lama, akhirnya Kita cancel & alasan mereka antri sesuai urutan ( sesuai urutan drmn, yg dateng setelah Kita aja udah keluar menunya ), setelah agak Pake year, akhirnya mereka mau mengcancel pesanan Kita yg belum keluar & sebagai kompensasi Kita dapat 2 bungkus nasi goreng ( disusulkan ketika Kita di parkiran ).
Untuk rasa makanan & minuman menurut kami gak enak ( maaf, tp selera setiap org berbeda ).
Pokoknya kesan pertama yg sangat mengecewakan.
Semoga jadi pelajaran buat pawon mbah gito ( karyawan ), semoga ke depan lebih baik.

SDM NYA SANGAT PERLU DI BERIKAN PEMBELAJARAN YANG LEBIH INTENSIF LAGI, BAGAIMANA SEHARUSNYA MELAYANI PENGUNJUNG RESTO.  SAYANG RESTO YANG CUKUP BAGUS INI MENJADI KURANG NYAMAN HANYA KARENA PELAYANANNYA SANGAT TIDAK RESPONSIF. PESAN TEH 2, YANG KELUAR 1. KONFIRMASI ULANG DIJAWAB IYA DITUNGGU.  KONFIRMASI LAGI DIJAWAB YANG BAWA NANTI BEDA.  KONFIRMASI LAGI BILANG IYA.  SAMPAI AKHIRNYA SELESAI MAKAN TEH TIDAK JUGA DIANTAR.  KESIMPULAN SDM NYA TIDAK ADA PENGETAHUAN BAGAIMANA MELAYANI PENGUNJUNG SECARA EFEKTIF. SAYA MENILAI NO 1 ADALAH KECEPATAN RESPONNYA.MAKANAN ENAK JADI NGGAK ENAK,  TEMPAT NYAMAN JADI KURANG NYAMAN. BAYANGKAN JIKA PEMBAYARANNYA BUKAN SETELAH MAKAN,  MAKANAN/MINUMAN YANG DIPESAN TIDAK KUNJUNG DATANG. SUDAH TERLANJUR BAYAR. SELERA LANGSUNG DROP HILANG.

Tempat luas, makanan banyak variasi, rasa cocok & cukup pas selera ada spot2 untuk foto², di kelingi persawahan, datang reservasi no meja makan, harga standar menengah, untuk orang² kota yang kangen masakan ndeso

Ini tempatnya ya bagus pemandangan sawah gitu
Aku suka wedangan mbah gito lebih strong. Konsep makannya prasmanan nasi + sayur 15.000 lauknya bayar sendiri.
Bumbunya kerasa banget
Bisa reservasi dulu
makanannya enak,tempatnya nyaman sejuk, cuman untuk pesanan pisang goreng dan bakwan jagungnya agak lama??
Makanannya enak, bikin nagih dan pengen ke sana terus. Pemandangannya juga bagus. Fasilitasnya nyaman, ada musholla yang lumayan luas juga.

Tempatnya punya vibes pedesaan yang menenangkan. Dikelilingi view sawah yang luas, jadi perfect banget buat healing sambil makan enak.

Menu makanannya juga beragam, lauknya super komplit, jadi buat yang bawa anak-anak nggak bakal bingung milih. Ada juga prasmanan sayur khas ndeso seperti lodeh jantung pisang, tempe bacem, dan lainnya. Snack tradisionalnya banyak banget, mulai dari pisang goreng, donat, sampai cake pun ada. Rasanya homey banget, cocok buat yang kangen masakan rumahan.

Tempatnya spacious dan comfy, dengan desain full kayu yang ngasih kesan tradisional tapi tetap Instagrammable. Banyak spot kece buat foto-foto. Area seatingnya fleksibel, bisa pilih duduk di pendopo depan, belakang, atau area indoor yang adem karena ber-AC.

Restoran ini juga family-friendly karena ada mini zoo yang lucu, ada burung, angsa, ikan, bahkan merak yang pasti bikin anak-anak happy.

Area parkirnya cukup luas dan akses ke lokasi gampang. Toilet juga bersih dan jumlahnya cukup, bahkan di hari ramai sekalipun.

Soal harga? Super affordable! Menu buffet sayur mulai dari Rp10.000-an, dan jajanan lainnya juga ramah di kantong. Cocok buat makan rame-rame tanpa bikin dompet kaget.

Overall, Pawon Mbah Gito jadi pilihan tepat buat hangout bareng keluarga atau teman, sambil menikmati suasana alam yang calming dan makanan tradisional yang worth to try!

Enak, cuma gak worth it, antri hanya untuk menu ala warteg ala carte. 6 orang, rata rata cuma  ada yg nambah telur, ikan, daging ayam ( menu yg dishare di  google, gak ada, no bebek no ayam kampung no daging sapi??) atmosphere gak special

Tempatnya nyaman, parkiran luas, menunya bervariasi, sistemnya prasmanan. Cocok buat kumpul² keluarga. Tpi saya rasa Kurang cocok untuk kaum mendang mending seperti saya, karena harganya yg lumayan "uwawww" mengagetkan

Mahaaaal ya  Allah, makanan kelas warteg, makan berenam 300 rb, pindang telur, ikan, sate lilit, telur dadar, ayam 2 nasi 6, teh 6. Jatuh per orang 50 rb, antriiiii. Cukup sekali saja hahaha
Suasana nya kaya bali,keren??????

Nothing to fault. Lovely staff, so much choice of food and lots of space. Food was good! If you want a taste of kampung Indonesian food I do really recommend and will be bringing foreign friends and family!

Very good restaurant with good food too.

The place looks small from outside but its huge inside, they have fish pond and also some farm animals.
Worth to try!

Enjoy Indonesia ????

This place is really nice. Too clean and cozy for just a restaurant. But, their food was too mediocre. All the food was cold and nothing special. , it's especially too expensive for just that kind of food or beverages.
This place is not for locals. It's for people from another city who want to experience expensive javanese home cooking.

I came here for iftar during Ramadan. It was very crowded and the line was quite long, but the food was worth it. There were many options, and the taste reminded me of home-cooked meals.

One thing that really concerned me was the ducks/geese kept in an open cage. A lot of kids were throwing stones at them, and there didnt seem to be any supervision. If the animals can't be properly cared for, it might be better not to keep them or at least give them a safer, more protected space.

Pawon Mbah Gito is a hidden gem that perfectly combines aesthetic charm with delicious traditional cuisine. Nestled amidst lush rice fields, the restaurant offers a stunning view that provides a serene and picturesque dining experience. Whether youre seated indoors with its rustic, vintage decor or outdoors enjoying the calming view of the paddy fields, every corner is Instagram-worthy.

The menu is a celebration of authentic Indonesian flavors, offering a wide variety of traditional dishes to suit every palate. From savory meats to refreshing vegetable-based dishes, each item is thoughtfully prepared to bring out the rich heritage of local culinary traditions. The portions are generous, and the taste is truly satisfying.

The ambiance, food, and overall vibe make Pawon Mbah Gito more than just a restaurantits an experience. If youre looking for a place to enjoy delicious food while soaking in a peaceful and culturally rich atmosphere, this is the perfect spot. Highly recommended for those seeking a unique and memorable culinary journey!
Makan prasmanan dengan masakan2 kampung yang punya cita rasa asli masakan simbah2 kita dulu.

Generally speaking, food is delicious and fresh. It would help a bit if the buffet is provided with the names of the dishes.

The atmosphere is that of a serene village hall, with vintage furniture to go with it. Some of the chairs & tables are a bit short for me, but I'm taller than most Indonesians so that's still OK.

One that bothers me a bit is the toilet near the front terrace. It's actually adequate except for the annoying fact that there's no disposal basket for the men's room, and because of that I saw used toilet papers stacked above the paper-roll. Just a little thing but it's quite a big turn-off in otherwise a beautiful place to eat. Fortunately, the other toilets are still OK. I would've given five stars if that particular toilet was better.

A little piece of advice for those who want to dine in during weekends, make an advance reservation first.
Recommended place to hang out with friends or family. Various food and beverages options. Good atmospheres. The food tastes great.

Ho speso relativamente tanto perché ho preso diversi piatti a menù, ma se si fa ip buffet, riso più tre scelte, si sta sulle 13k rupie, nulla.
Il posto è molto suggestivo perché da sulla risaia e con la possibilità di vedere il vulcano nello sfondo. Molto rilassante e soprattutto frequentato solo da locali.

A good place to bring your family for lunch or dinner. It serve home-cook Javanese cuisine with some modern menu as well.

You will experience "prasmanan" style or self-served here. The food is good & price is reasonable.

Not sure if this place is currently trending on social media, but when I came for lunch on the weekend, it was pretty busy. You had to queue to get a table.

They have buffet-style and also the ala carte menu but that only available from certain time. For example, on the weekend itll start at 3 PM.

They have different kind of Javanese food, from veggie, fish, chicken, beef, egg, and many more. They have two types of rice, white and red rice. You can take whatever you like and the cashier will calculate it for you. Id say the food is nice, but its not up to my delicious level. But its okay considering the surroundings that youre in while having the meal.

I have to say the view of this restaurant is amazing. The paddy field is green and it looks fresh to be surrounded by greeneries.

Pawon Mbah Gito is a unique dining spot that captures the essence of traditional Javanese culture. Nestled in a rustic, antique setting, this restaurant combines the charm of an old Javanese village with a cozy, welcoming atmosphere. From the decor to the traditional music softly playing in the background, everything here feels authentic and thoughtfully arranged, offering guests a memorable cultural experience along with their meal.

I tried the bakmie, and I found it quite enjoyable. The noodles were well-cooked with a nice, slightly chewy texture, and the seasoning was balanced, bringing out a rich, savory flavor. It had just the right amount of sweetness, which is common in Javanese cuisine, and the ingredients tasted fresh and well-prepared. While it might not be the best bakmie Ive ever had, it was definitely satisfying, and I could appreciate the home-cooked feel that the dish offered.

The service at Pawon Mbah Gito was also warm and attentive, adding to the pleasant experience. The staff members seemed genuinely friendly and were happy to share recommendations or explain the menu items. This level of hospitality made the meal feel even more special, and its clear that they are dedicated to maintaining the restaurants cultural atmosphere while ensuring customers are comfortable.

Overall, Pawon Mbah Gito is a place I would recommend for anyone looking to experience traditional Javanese food in a charming, heritage-rich setting. It may not be the most refined bakmie in town, but the ambiance and authenticity of the restaurant make it worth a visit.

Its a la carte, with various traditional food. They also take some snacks by request. The food is tasty with affordable price. They also have a variety of beverages and drinks (coffee as well).
They have a spacious area in the back with a roof top and indoor area. With rice field view it's best to come here in the morning or afternoon to enjoy scenery and a nice breeze.
The restaurant is neat and clean with a very polite and helpful crew. I do recommend you try this place, especially to enjoy local cuisine and nice scenery.
There is a very comfortable praying room inside the restaurant as well, even though there is a mosque nearby.

Seru banget si makan di situ..
My best tip is .. avoid coming around 12 noon to 1.30 pm .. they were packed .. and hard to get or choose a table that you like as well, long queue for the food stall

They serve hybrid all you can take and individual item :
For vegie : all you can take + rice (1 kali ambil) = Rp. 14K (max 2/3 veggies)
Other than that, it is counted as individual items.

The food is simple and delicious!
A home cooking style and taste.
?? it!

The place is just like a home with a lot of terrace areas and a bit of padi  field .. woods furniture, outdoors no aircon .. village vibe  ..
I wish the place could be much cleaner.. and cooler ..

Even though it is a village style, they staff use handy talky to communicate to each other, so they are quite fast to assist our needs.

Uniquely, they also serve some modern pastries .. ?? ??..

Certainly will return! And will try the pastry..

Traditional Javanese restaurant with complete selection of traditional food and drinks or wedangan, also traditional snacks. The place was crowded when i went there, thankfully there's still some seats left.  The services were good enough, most of the waitresses are teenagers so they work very fast, even though most of them have a hard time finding the table number associated with the order. All and all very good restaurant, located in the middle of rice fields, so it was fresh and cool. The food and drinks are also delicious.  Very recommended.

All rounder in javanese traditional dishes family resto! A must visit in the northern part of Jogja. Rp13k for rice and up to 3 variants of vegetables side dishes, the rest of tasteful proteins or "lauk" will add on the final price. The food is tasty, and they also have wide variety of beverages, even cake and bakery now ?? quiet big spaces newly established, still enough even for the holidays or weekends' peak hours when I went there (even have new parking lots for cars outside now). Very enjoyable visit for families or friends ????????????

Very suitable restaurant in case of craving for some Javanese and Yogyakarta's traditional meals. The surrounding green-farm field are sooo pleasant! The staff are friendly and helpful, the service is fast and satisfying

pilihan lauknya banyakkk sistem prasmanan
paling suka soun nya sama sayur lodehnya medok rasanya drpd sebelah hehe??
viewnya sejukkk sawah sawah kalau sore lebih adem
cocok buat kumpul sama keluarga??

kopi klothok's rival is here. if you look for authentic javanese cuisine with family or friends, but not too crowded and more pleasante place to sit, here is the option. they have more option of foods(compare to kopi klothok), there are plenty various foods and soup.

food are really good, they have several unique baverges it tasted good also. the price is affordable.

eventhough in peak hour, the staff are quite fast with the service. the impiortant thing if the place is full, the parking staff will inform you before you park the car, you will not be forced to come and wait too long.

This week, I had the opportunity to have a family lunch to celebrate my mother's birthday at Pawon Mbah Gito. It was our second visit; we had been here once before, in the evening. During the daytime, it was bustling with visitors, and the food was still piping hot from the kitchen. The place is unique, suitable for family and friends as well as office colleagues gathering. One of the dishes from the buffet that I really enjoyed was the spicy and savory ayam suwir, it had just the right balance of flavors. The vegetable soup was also delicious, and their beras kencur (a traditional Indonesian drink) was delightful. For dessert, the mocha cake turned out to be quite tasty and definitely worth ordering again. Overall, I appreciated the food ordering system and the attentive service. This place is worth revisiting !

If you enjoy traditional Javanese foods, Mbah Gito is a favorite restaurant to visit for family and friends. On weekends it opens at 7AM, a favorite place for bikers to have breakfast. The foods and snacks are authentic and great tasting, but mostly on the sweet side. In addition to the traditional herbal drinks (wedang), thankfully, they also serve cappuccino and latte. The prices for foods and drinks are quite reasonable. For example a plate of rice with 3 vegetables is only Rp. 13K. Cappuccino and latte is Rp. 29K each.
You can find delicious typical Javanese foods here. The coffee is not to my taste (I tried Kopi Susu Mbah Gito), but it's worth to try if you want to experience Indonesian-style coffee.
If Klotak coffee is too crowded, maybe you can stop by here

This restaurant offers you beautiful scenery of rice field. This place is suitable for gathering your family or even just having some cups of coffee with your friend or partner. They offer various menu of meals, snacks and beverages. Though the price is pricey, I still enjoyed the atmosphere and what I like the most is that they provide various coffee bean. Here you can find a praying room, toilets, and sinks. I'm not sure if there's a WIFI since this place purpose is more like to dine. There is no wheelchair accessibility. The parking lot is wide enough and guarded. Over all, ok lah.

The service could definitely use some improvement. The girl with the HT looked super exhausted and busy, but she wasn't. I'm a foodie who's always on the hunt for good food and great service, but this place missed the mark for me. Oh, except for the pisang gorengso yummy!

Even Kopi Klot*k, with so many customers, always nails their service. Please learn from them :)

Anyway, train your staff better and you'll get positive feedback from customers. That's the key. Thank you!

I came here because i found it on google maps which is close to where i live. Well i have fallen for this place at my first step when i came. The green rice fields, the area vibe was so cool and chillax. The Javanese style of their interiors and designs are perfect combo. The stuff were good and friendly. And most important they have delicious meals. The musholla is big and i am happy for that. It is well when magrib time you wanted to pray and you don't have  to wait and queue.

We went there after eating at couple restaurants, so we didt order much. We decided just to order mie lethek goreng and it didnt dissapoint! The seasoning was on point, savoury with justtt a lil bit of sweetness like we like it.

I go for dinner, having Nasi Goreng and Kwetiaw, although they are known for their Indonesian Food Buffet. And was having great service and taste!!

Their facility are also quite adequate with spacious area and a large praying room. Recommended for family or event large gatherings.

come here during the holiday season. rather difficult to find a seat. good food but there is a sweet taste like Jogja food. the drink took a long time to come out, had to ask many times. the view is a magnificent.

A popular Javanese restaurant next to a green rice field. I had Ramadhan fast breaking with my wife in a very crowded but cozy atmosphere enjoying rice, cooked papaya leaves, oseng tahu, fried tempe, a big egg omelette, tapioca crackers, hot tea, and iced lemon. Unfortunately the cooked papaya leaves were too salty, and the iced lemon was too sour. Self-service dishes and ala carte menu. There are a few outdoor tables, a garden with ponds and a pair of swans, spacious joglo buildings, a fish pond, and a meeting room. Clean restrooms and spacious musholla. At the restaurant and neighboring places there are spacious parking lots for motorbikes, cars and minibuses. Another minus: rather slow free WiFi.

delicious &super affordable. excellent service from every staff. plenty of seating spots available. plenty of car parking space available also. since its very crowded on weekends, i suggest yall to visit on weekdays. hard recommend ????

The food and beverage are good, the portions are generous. For the big crowd and group dining, I'll recommend this place.
The real javanese home cooked food. You can choose everything you like and make your own nasi campur. Yum!!

Found this place on Instagram. This place is similiar with another modern traditional restaurant. With a rice field view, traditional food and joglo resto. The price is a bit pricey than others, the taste is so so not special. But they serve a carte menu over 1pm. But theres a gutter that ur kids can explore. I think The parking space is not quite spacious to place a lot of car on weekend
Good place to have business meetings. We can reserve special room while ordering coffee and snacks. Afterwards, we can have a buffet lunch. Also sufficient place for praying.
Nice place with authentic concepts. Good place to chill out with family or friends. They provide rice field view with many style of sitting types.

3 times visiting pawon mbah gito, never dissapointed! Its very javanese from the foods to ambience. Good option for you who seeking family restaurant. I suggest you for coming in the morning cause there are many option for foods.

Try this resto for indonesian culinary. Situated at outskirt jogja city. The place surrounded with paddy field. The food is good, the crispy fried chicken is great. And the price is very affordable. Great place overall.

Overall, I had a wonderful family lunch.

YOU MUST COME

I was honestly about to rate the place 3 stars about a misunderstanding about price. I thought I paid 792k, which was clearly a rip off. My bad, it's just 192k
.I realized it when incjecked my bill after I arrived home. That's a sweet spot for a meal with 3 people. The concept is simple : it's a buffet with traditional Javanese food that they keep fresh all day long. They offer for example 2 types of rice, brown and white which is extremely rare 8n Indonesia. So you take your plate and cutlery, and you choose your food. Simple concept, with a limited number of options (20 or 25 choices) but largely enough. There is an extra counter for coffee drinks and desserts.
The restaurant, made of several traditional buildings, joglo type, with vintage furniture , is simple, like the food, but everything matches.
A good place to visit, enjoyable food, reasonable price.

Overall the service is good, follows health protocols, the place is comfortable, fresh and beautiful.  The catfish mangut is great, the coffee with Javanese sugar is like drinking Swedish-style fika coffee, the price is moderate, the vegetable rice package is interesting.  The lime ice is fresh.  I recommend this Pawon to visit.
Nice place, view, and food. Even more tasty than many famous legendary restos in jogja. Suitable for sweet thooth.
Delicious soto rawon ,nice place

The promotion clearly said that nasi sayur sepuasnya for 10k but the truth is it's only for the white rice. For the veggies you'll be charged for every portion you took, so it's just a false advertising if not a misguided one.

Spent evening meal in this open space Eatery with family, feeling blessed. The place is one of 'nature blend caffee n eatery' where you can enjoy your meal while pleasing your eyes with natural scenary of paddy fields. .
The scene is soo good. They have clean and neat little mosque, superb! Foods are good, but little bit pricey

Hi... I'm your regular customer haha.. I really love this comfortable place... I usually sit on the back near fish pool... Love this situation beside rice field and nice food too.

It was my first time at this restaurant and it was Friday so it was kinda crowded.
The food choices and taste were okay not that spicy but referred to as sweetness.
I liked one of their traditional drink which is a combination of ginger and lemon grass.
My partner and I were digging into our food and we saw small flies on one of the dishes.
I directly told the staff and he discarded the whole dishes right away.
They were all friendly and enthusiastic about their job however when we checked out she added a few items to our check that we didn't order so it's overcharged.
We noticed that while we were already at the parking lot so then I had to run back to the restaurant and ask her to correct the balance.
Hopefully, they will take this comment as a lesson to be more attentive.
Overall it was just a mediocre experience we had.

A perfect place for lunch! Buffet style (Prasmanan) restaurant but we can also order fritters for sharing portion. full of comfort javanese food that was very delicious and tasty, they give lots of options for traditional beverages too. the place is more spacious than before which is good and the cleanliness of the place shouldnt be doubt at all. the view of paddy field which can makes you sleepy and calm at the same time is a bonus point, a good place to hang out with family & friends or even alone for work from cafe (wfc). although it is sometimes crowded in the peak of lunch time, the staffs still manage the guests very well.

There is more food on the menu outside the self service. I just found out when i ordered drinks from the menu. Ambiance is relaxing even when it is crowded. Eating areas are ever expanding to accomodate more guest.

Looking for a place to enjoy quality time with your family? Pawon Mbah Gito is the perfect choice. With delicious, home-cooked meals and a warm, rustic atmosphere, its ideal for bringing your parents or loved ones. The strong village charm and traditional vibes make every visit feel like a cozy escape to the countryside.

Tips: If youre visiting Pawon Mbah Gito, you absolutely cannot miss these three standout items on the menu: Lodeh, pisang goreng, es dawet. You wont disappoint ??

It is a great place to enjoy the dinner, has spacious parking area, tables and places. The food is so yummy, i like local food which is served in that place and also the restaurant has a beautiful view to the rice field so it can refresh our mind

If you're looking for an authentic and affordable Indonesian dining experience that's also Instagram-worthy, look no further than Pawon Mbah Gito. While it may be a bit of a trek from the city center, the journey is worth it for the delicious food and stunning rice field setting. And for Muslim travelers, the prayer room is a thoughtful touch. This restaurant is a must-visit for anyone seeking an unforgettable culinary experience that won't break the bank. Trust me, your taste buds and your Instagram feed will thank you!
